newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch shares close higher, index up on Royal Dutch.
newsitem.headline: Dutch shares close higher, index up on Royal Dutch.

text.p: Dutch shares ended at a fresh record close on Thursday, the fifth AEX record in a row.
The AEX blue chip index ended 6.92 points higher at 712.50 points. The AMX "midcap" index closed 14 points up at 1099.88.
Dealers said trade was dominated by professional traders, but also pointed to growing retail interest.
Trade focused on Royal Dutch and Philips which both released their annual results in the morning.
Royal Dutch, which announced a four-for-one share split, also dominated options trade. The shares added 11.70 guilders to close at 347.50.
"The figures were just fabulous, the split is great. Nobody expected things to be this good," one dealer said.
Philips, which reported a Q4 loss, dipped in the morning but soon recovered to end at 81.00 guilders, up 2.90 from Wednesday's close.
Dealers pointed out the large size of many deals, suggesting the major buyers of the stock were likely foreign parties.
"Besides, no Dutch investor would buy the stock at these levels. Anybody following the company knows it's bad stuff," one dealer said, adding his analyst agreed.
Another said buyers returned after the analyst meeting.
"I heard some very positive echoes of the meeting," he said.
One trader attributed the rise to the Boonstra effect.
"He's a very good speaker, convincing people his reorganisations are going to work out fine," she said.
Good sentiment towards the semiconductor sector led computer software Baan 5.20 guilders higher to 93.70, while ASM International added 1.50 guilders to 31.50 guilders.
However, one dealer played down the rise.
"Those semis are hocus pocus to me. Put it all in a pot and start mixing. Tomorrow the shares might just as well lose double the amount they gained today," he said.
Polygram, which released figures on Wednesday, ended down 2.40 guilders at 86.10 on disappointment that Philips has no plans to shed its 75 percent stake in the company.
Shares of food group Nutricia ended 3.40 guilders higher at 277.40. Dealers attributed the rise to the end of the salmonella scare concerning the company's baby food.
